body: Ask me anything, and I'll do my best to answer honestly.
body_tagged: Ask me anything, and I'll do my best to answer honestly.
title: AMA (Summer)

replies.body:
Opinions?

Opinions on your new fancy dark red rank?

What was your first reaction when you were promoted?
replies.body_tagged:
Opinions?

Opinions on your new fancy dark red rank?

What was your first reaction when you were promoted?

replies.body:
Opinions?
You're actually pretty nice now. I think your behavior and maturity has improved a lot in the past six months, so good job on that.

In all honesty though, I don't actually know you all that well. Maybe that'll change in the future.

Opinions on your new fancy dark red rank?
Looks nice, but it is a bit weird seeing it ingame. I guess it solves the inconsistency of me having a blue rank ingame but a cyan rank on discord.

In terms of the rank itself, I hope I'll be able to bring something to the team. I don't plan to abandon the other things I do, though. Can't wait for those new rotations!

What was your first reaction when you were promoted?
Yay, I guess all those people who didn't put me in their sr mod prediction lists were wrong.

replies.body:
opinions
You're inconsistent. About 65% of the time you are a great person to talk to, and the rest of the time you are surprisingly toxic. Sometimes you make really good suggestions, but it can be easy to forget that after looking at some of your other posts.

You should chill. Like I said, if you stop being unnecessarily rude, you're actually a great guy. You also know XML which is cool.

will the mapdev team be successful
I think it will be. The situation has improved, a bit.

replies.body:
Opinions?

All I really knew about you until recently is that you play Avicus.

When I got promoted, you seemed to be extremely displeased. I get the impression that you may have lied when answering my question on your AMA, since it's unlikely that your opinion would shift so much in the span of a few hours.

If you actually want to tell me something, feel free to message me on discord. Otherwise, I don't really have much else to say.

replies.body:
Opinions?
You're pretty nice in general, and are well rounded. If you don't know something, you learn fairly quickly. 
You'll probably get promoted to mapdev sometime in the near future. It really depends on you.

If you ever end up doing that meetup, I'll probably show up.

What map are you most proud of?
Ogel asked this question already, so please look at my response to him.

Any projects you have in mind?
I have a few more CTW ideas that I may make maps for.

replies.body:
Opinions?
You've improved a lot in the past six months, both as a person and as a moderator. You're much better at communicating now. A lot of people thought you were going to be one of the new sr mods, but I guess that didn't happen. Better luck next time.

What's one thing you want to do as a senior that you feel would make the biggest impact on the community?
I honestly don't know. It's not like I've made a roadmap of exactly what I'm going to do as sr mod.

Have a good summer B)
Thank you!

replies.body:
Was your promotion to Senior Mod more expected or more unexpected?
In terms of others, it appears a lot of people didn't think I was going to get it.

Personally, though, I'm not going to say that I was super surprised. It was of course somewhat unexpected, but I did always think that eventually it might happen.

replies.body:
Opinion?
You're mostly fine, but I guess at some point you may have been a bit immature. In all honesty, even though I know a lot about you, I really don't have much of an opinion for some reason. We haven't really talked much since T5, and even then our talk was purely about the T5 maps.

Why avicus?
I think Avicus still can be improved and eventually gain more players, if advertising is done properly. In addition, I somewhat enjoy actually playing on the server.

replies.body:
Opinions?
You were an okay mod (you had the rank for a really long time for some reason), and a fine mentor. I really have no doubts about you or your capabilities.

Will Cord ever be given access to rotation editing? Why or why not?
No.

Cord has retired. We do not rely on people who are no longer on the map development team to perform map development tasks.

Why are maps like Dust Devils and Halcyon still in rotations? In the previous rotation, they were the most enjoyable maps but considering they've been in rotations endlessly for the past year or so, they're getting a bit dry.
There's a reason that Dust Devils is still in the rotations, and it has nothing to do with Halcyon.

Halcyon was one of the nostalgic maps I added to rotations in order to somewhat appease the community, who I thought would have otherwise endlessly complained about the lack of Throwback in the rotations. It appears to have served its purpose until recently.

How often do you plan on changing the rotations?
I see a lot of people demanding rotation updates every week or two weeks. To those people, I have to ask; what do you want me to do? Completely redo the rotation every two weeks? If we had a hundred good maps of each gamemode, maybe we could actually do proper biweekly rotation updates. But, there simply aren't enough maps (unless you want them to be endlessly recirculated in and out, which is just an unnecessary hassle in my opinion.)

Keep in mind that I'm talking here about significant rotation updates. Of course, we will still constantly maintain the rotations by removing bad maps, and possibly adding newer ones. In fact, maybe this can be we will do: Instead of having a large update every month (certainly not every two weeks), we could replace maps more frequently in much smaller portions.

To definitively answer your question, the frequency of future rotation changes is currently undecided. My thoughts on the matter are described in the above two paragraphs.

If you have any questions about anything that I said in this post, feel free to message me on discord.

replies.body:
Did you expect yourself to get Senior Mod when you first got Junior Mod?
I honestly don't remember exactly what I was thinking 11 months ago. I might have been thinking about it to some degree, but I was definitely more focused on passing my trial first. Once I got mentor, that's probably when I actually seriously started thinking about the possibility of being a sr mod at some point.

How did it feel when you got Senior mod?
Slightly surprising, slightly refreshing, and I guess it actually made me feel good, which I find happens less frequently these days (in terms of Avicus.)

What do you think you can contribute as a Senior Mod for server such as Avicus? Especially since the state it is in.
I'm sure you know what the sr mod team does. So, I'll be doing some of that, while also focusing on other responsibilities that I have. What can I contribute? That is a difficult question. I can't think of any answers that aren't extremely obvious (such as, mod experience, mapdev knowledge, etc.) Take that as you will; I'm sorry for not providing a more detailed answer.

As a builder, you have a lot of potential, both in terms of gameplay and aesthetics. I am eager to see what you will come up with in the future.

opinions?
Before you retired, you were steadily improving your building skills. I was actually really disappointed when you were banned, and I have to say I don't fully agree with the situation surrounding the ban (not that that actually matters; it's over with at this point, and nothing can really change.) If you're still around by the time you get appealed, you're welcome to return to the builder team if you wish.

grats on sr :)
Thank you!

replies.body:
Would you rather change the rotations (slightly) every day or once per year?
If it's only between those two choices, it would have to be slightly changing the rotations every day. Keeping the rotations the same for an entire year would probably actually kill the server, and that's not one of my goals here.

Are you planning on making more great maps soon?
Quite possibly. I started building a new 4 team CTW the other day, but I don't know how soon it will be done.

Opinions? (I know you told me your opinions about me quite recently, where you were completely honest, but maybe I became better since then)
I'd say my opinions of you are very different now, than they were six months ago. I think you're a really nice guy, and were a good mapdev; I was pretty sad when you retired. Whatever you're doing now, I hope you're successful. Take care.

Fish?
Sometimes, I guess. I don't eat fish too much, but I try to at least have it at least once in a while, in order to get the proper vitamins.

Quite possibly. I started building a new 4 team CTW the other day, but I don't know how soon it will be done.

Opinions? (I know you told me your opinions about me quite recently, where you were completely honest, but maybe I became better since then)
I'd say my opinions of you are very different now, than they were six months ago. I think you're a really nice guy, and were a good mapdev; I was pretty sad when you retired. Whatever you're doing now, I hope you're successful. Take care.

Fish?
Sometimes, I guess. I don't eat fish too much, but I try to at least have it at least once in a while, in order to get the proper vitamins.

replies.body:
My question, what areas of the network do you plan on focusing on during your tenure as Sr?
For now, at least, it looks like I'll still be focusing on map development things. Of course, that may change in the future.

Is there anything you specifically want to work on first now that you have a bit more say in things?
Not really. For now, I'm going with the flow, and participating in discussions whenever necessary.

And Opinions on me if you have any..I suppose that's the norm with AMAs these days.
I have to give you credit; I think you made a fairly successful effort to improve your moderation in the past six months. So, good job on that. In addition, it's cool that you decided not to become one of those staff members who become unnecessarily toxic after retiring.

replies.body:
Do you know me in ocn?
A lot of your past names are very similar to names of other people, which makes answering this question difficult. I would say, the answer is probably yes.

How long you have been in this server?
I joined in July of 2014, but I only really started actively playing Avicus during the summer of 2016.

Are you good at anything when you become the builder in this server?
This question is worded a bit weirdly, but if you're asking if I'm good at building, I would say that I'm not the best, but sometimes I've actually made really good maps.

What teams have you been before?
Home (for a few months).
Teamlas (for a few days, as a meme).

replies.body:
Opinions?
I disagree with many of your beliefs, and as a result it is difficult for me to actually like you. To your credit, though, you've done a good job of being a very reasonable person to talk to.

You're also a decent moderator. Keep up the good work.

Can you help me with map pls thank
I'm not great at making things look nice. I think the best way I could help would be by giving layout & gameplay feedback.

replies.body:
Opinions on me?
We used to disagree on many issues, but I guess that was almost a year ago. I'm not sure of what you actually think about most things, these days. You don't speak your mind very much; when you do your opinion is often somewhat surprising. In general, though, you're a good person. You're also a decent mod, I guess.

What are your opinions on Walls?
Having a walls server isn't hurting Avicus. Even if it's not super popular, it does have a small dedicated community that could grow.

What are your opinions about what my plans with Walls?
I don't really know if they can actually make walls popular, but by all means go for it.

replies.body:
Opinions on me?
Really nice guy, and a great mod. I guess you will forever be the only person who I got to "mentor". Maybe that is for the best; apparently I wasn't that great of a mentor. If that's true, I'm sorry.

How's Life?
Fine, fine. My second year of university is coming up in september, so for now I'm just trying to enjoy the remainder of the summer as much as I can.

What's Good?
It's somewhat late at night when I write this, so I don't think I can give you a good response to this question. My sincerest apologies.
